content: marble fidget square designed by shana s cohen after creating a knit marble fidget bracelet for my son i came up with the idea to use double knitting to make a pocket sized fidget toy i like the small scale of this project for experimenting with a tubular cast-on and tubular bind-off while also making a small functional piece test knitting norah b wendy k wendy n-h louise r amanda u materials yarn tools sample used approximately 4-5 g of a superwash us 3 3 25 mm circular needle 16 40 cm or straight needles merino and nylon dk weight yarn a dk weight spare needle in same size yarn in wool or synthetic fibers will work scissors smooth waste yarn gauge tapestry needle 5 sts = 1 2 5 cm in double-knit stockinette 1 standard glass marble for each square 1/2 13 mm diameter measured on one side of fabric some testers used decorative glass craft beads or flat-bottomed glass drops in lieu of standard marbles size sample shown is approximately 2 5 cm square abbreviations used k knit rs right side sl1wyif slip 1 stitch purlwise with yarn in front ws wrong side yo yarnover directions this fidget square is a double-knit fabric and uses a variation on a 1x1 tubular cast-on with waste yarn using smooth waste yarn cast on 10 stitches with the backwards loop cast-on if you desire a larger piece cast on more stitches the first row doubles the cast on number by adding a yarnover after each stitch the waste yarn will stay in the piece for at least 3 row on each side of the fabric and then it can be removed set up row 1 rs k1 yo to end of row there are now 20 stitches on the needle or twice your original cast on note the final yarnover can feel a little awkward on the next row knit this stitch through the back loop row 2 ws k1 sl1wyif to end of row work row 2 on both rs and ws of work until piece is desired length remove waste yarn from starting row without working any stitches slip the first stitch from left working needle to right needle then slip the second stitch from left working needle to spare needle continue to slip every other stitch in this way until all stitches have been slipped there will be 10 stitches on the front needle and 10 stitches on the back needle see photos on p 2 place 1 marble into the pouch created before closing the pouch take a moment to thread tapestry needle through starting yarn tail and pull it to the inside of the fabric no worries if you forget to do this you can just weave this tail in at the end cut working yarn leaving at least a 12 30 cm tail thread yarn onto darning needle and close the top of the pouch by grafting
